author: Saumya Vaishampayan
title: Asian Bond Markets Barely Blink After U.S. Treasury Yields Hit 3%
text: Asian government bond yields edged up Wednesday after the benchmark U.S. government bond yield touched 3% for the first time in more than four years overnight. Yields ticker higher in Korea and China, though the moves were small. Koreaâ€™s 10-year government bond yield rose to 2.752%, up from 2.727% Tuesday.
